title: Dennis Gabor
summary: Dennis Gabor CBE FRS[1] (Hungarian: Gábor Dénes; Hungarian pronunciation: [ˈɡaːbor ˈdeːnɛʃ], /ˈɡɑːbɔːr, ɡəˈbɔːr/ GAH-bor, gə-BOR;[3][4][5][6] 5 June 1900 – 9 February 1979) was a Hungarian-British electrical engineer and physicist, most notable for inventing holography, for which he later received the 1971 Nobel Prize in Physics.[7][8][9][10][11][12] He obtained British citizenship in 1934, and spent most of his life in England.[13][14]
